title: >>> The BUTLER CAMPAIGN
body_text:
The beginning of Season 9 couldn't have been any more memorable, or even comedic, as the world witnessed the
CREAMations
of Lenny Herrera and John Tronolone. Well, the great game of dodgeball picks up right where it left off.
DODGEBALL 82 comes live April 7 and what a night it is going to be. The spotlight shines on one man, awaiting an very unfamiliar challenge.
Mike Butler
, one of the most gifted atheletes of the modern era and certainly one of the game's finest dodging legends, has been given a golden opportunity heading into the anticipated 82nd dodgeball extravaganza. History will be made on April 7 when Butler enters his tryout captains showdown. His opponent however remains nameless ...
But fear not! The popular
Rimshot Contest
returns after 4 and 1/2 months!
The History of the Rimshot Contest
I.
DODGEBALL 50 (August 4, 2006): Brothers Tom and Chris Adams win the first contest of its kind, earning the right to face their other siblings Steve and then-Captains Champion Kevin.
II.
DODGEBALL 51 (August 12, 2007): Ryan Letsche defeats 8 veterans becoming the first singles contest winner. Unfortunately, Ryan would be defeated by Kevin Adams later that night.
III.
DODGEBALL FIFTY-TWO (August 19, 2006): Ryan Letsche makes history winning his second straight contest. Ryan would gain a measure of revenge by beating Kevin Adams in their rematch.
IV.
DODGEBALL 53 (August 26, 2006): Derek Carty and Chris Adams emerge as the two sole survivors in the fourth
Rimshot Contest
. It was the first time co-winners went on to face each other.
V.
DODGEBALL LX (October 21, 2006): The team of Mark Entwistle and John Tronolone join co-winners Dan Spengeman and Sara DeCuir. The two combos would headline this 60th dodgeball spectacular.
It's the easiest pre-game ever created! The sole survivor of dodgeball's 6th
Rimshot Contest
will face Mike Butler at DODGEBALL 82!
--->>  MIKE BUTLER vs.
___???___
Special thanks to Dan Spengeman for the creation of yet another classic promotional poster.
body_html:
The beginning of Season 9 couldn't have been any more memorable, or even comedic, as the world witnessed the CREAMations of Lenny Herrera and John Tronolone. Well, the great game of dodgeball picks up right where it left off.

DODGEBALL 82 comes live April 7 and what a night it is going to be. The spotlight shines on one man, awaiting an very unfamiliar challenge.

Mike Butler, one of the most gifted atheletes of the modern era and certainly one of the game's finest dodging legends, has been given a golden opportunity heading into the anticipated 82nd dodgeball extravaganza. History will be made on April 7 when Butler enters his tryout captains showdown. His opponent however remains nameless ...

But fear not! The popular Rimshot Contest returns after 4 and 1/2 months!

The History of the Rimshot Contest
I. DODGEBALL 50 (August 4, 2006): Brothers Tom and Chris Adams win the first contest of its kind, earning the right to face their other siblings Steve and then-Captains Champion Kevin.

II. DODGEBALL 51 (August 12, 2007): Ryan Letsche defeats 8 veterans becoming the first singles contest winner. Unfortunately, Ryan would be defeated by Kevin Adams later that night.

III. DODGEBALL FIFTY-TWO (August 19, 2006): Ryan Letsche makes history winning his second straight contest. Ryan would gain a measure of revenge by beating Kevin Adams in their rematch.

IV. DODGEBALL 53 (August 26, 2006): Derek Carty and Chris Adams emerge as the two sole survivors in the fourth Rimshot Contest. It was the first time co-winners went on to face each other.

V. DODGEBALL LX (October 21, 2006): The team of Mark Entwistle and John Tronolone join co-winners Dan Spengeman and Sara DeCuir. The two combos would headline this 60th dodgeball spectacular.

It's the easiest pre-game ever created! The sole survivor of dodgeball's 6th Rimshot Contest will face Mike Butler at DODGEBALL 82!


--->> MIKE BUTLER vs. ___???___




Special thanks to Dan Spengeman for the creation of yet another classic promotional poster.
